Overview

TAF Scheduler is a web application that provides a convenient way to generate schedules that describe to TAF Test Executor how your tests should be run. For detailed information on schedules, please see this page.

TAF Scheduler strives to as far as possible remove the necessity for manual creation of schedules. Schedules are complex XML documents and mistakes can be made. Such mistakes can be costly given the time that it takes to execute Maintrack CI loops and team KGB+N jobs. TAF Scheduler provides the user with features such as automatic schedule validation, schedule versioning and a mechanism to enable users to send schedules for peer review.

Also provided is access control to your schedules. Schedules belong to a team and the team(s) available to a user are derived from LDAP roles for Cloud access - see Section 7 of this document for details on access to the SPP Cloud areas. Any user of TAF Scheduler may view any schedule, but he or she may only edit schedules that belong to his or her team.

In addition to the schedule creation, validation and review functionality outlined above, TAF Scheduler also provides functionality to record the execution history of Maintrack schedules in concert with TAF Test Executor. That is, each time that TAF Test Executor retrieves a schedule from TAF Scheduler and executes it, it reports back the Product ISO version, Testware ISO version that were used in the test run. This data is stored in the TAF Scheduler database enabling a recreation of that test run at any point in the future.
